Source: ast.js

const inspect = require('util').inspect;
const ins = (x) => inspect(x, { depth: null });
const { specialForms } = require("./registry.js");

/**
 * Represents a node from the Abstract Syntax Tree of type value.
 */
class Value {
  constructor(token) {
    this.type = token.type;
    this.value = isNaN(token.value) ? token.value.replace(/"/g, '') : token.value;
  }

  /**
   * Evaluates the content of the node and returns its resulting value.
   * @returns result of evaluation
   */
  evaluate() {
    return this.value;
  }
}

/**
 * Represents a node from the Abstract Syntax Tree of type word.
 */
class Word {
  constructor(token) {
    this.type = token.type || 'word';
    this.name = token.name;
  }
  
  /**
   * Evaluates the content of the node and returns its resulting value.
   * @param {HashMap} env Represents the current scope program memory. 
   * @returns result of evaluation
   */
  evaluate(env) {
    if (this.name in env) {
      return env[this.name];
    } 
    throw new ReferenceError(`Undefined variable: ${this.name}`);
  }

  /**
   * Evaluates the content of the node and returns its resulting value.
   * It takes in account that the node is on the left side of an expression.
   * @param {HashMap} env Represents the current scope program memory. 
   * @returns result of evaluation
   */
  leftEvaluate(env) {
    // Look for the nearest environment that contains the name registred.
    for (let scope = env; scope; scope = Object.getPrototypeOf(scope)) {
      if (Object.prototype.hasOwnProperty.call(scope, this.name)) {
        return scope;
      }
    }

    throw new ReferenceError(`Tried setting an undefined variable: ${this.name}`);
  }
}

/**
 * Represents a node from the Abstract Syntax Tree of type apply.
 */
class Apply {
  constructor(tree) {
    this.type = tree.type;
    this.operator = tree.operator;
    this.args = tree.args;
  }

  /**
   * Evaluates the content of the node and returns its resulting value.
   * @param {HashMap} env Represents the current scope program memory. 
   * @returns result of evaluation
   */
  evaluate(env) {
    if (this.operator.type == 'word' && this.operator.name in specialForms) {
      return specialForms[this.operator.name](this.args, env);
    }

    let op = this.operator.evaluate(env);
    let argsProcessed = this.args.map((arg) => arg.evaluate(env));

    if ((typeof op === "function")) {
      return op(...argsProcessed);
    }

    throw new TypeError('Applying not a function or method ' + err);
  }

  leftEvaluate(env) {
    // Invalid leftEvaluate-hand side in assignment
  }
}

module.exports = { Value, Word, Apply };
